com.jjoe64.graphview.series

Class BaseSeries<E extends DataPointInterface>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jjoe64.graphview.series.BaseSeries<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Series<E>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BarGraphSeries, LineGraphSeries, PointsGraphSeries

    public abstract class BaseSeries<E extends DataPointInterface>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Series<E>
    Basis implementation for series. Used for series that are plotted on a default x/y 2d viewport. Extend this class to implement your own custom graph type. This implementation uses a internal Array to store the data. If you want to implement a custom data provider you may want to implement Series.

      • getValues

        public java.util.Iterator<E> getValues(double from,
                                       double until)
        get the values for a given x range. if from and until are bigger or equal than all the data, the original data is returned. If it is only a part of the data, the range is returned plus one datapoint before and after to get a nice scrolling.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface Series<E extends DataPointInterface>
        Parameters:
        from - minimal x-value
        until - maximal x-value
        Returns:
        data for the range +/- 1 datapoint

      • resetData

        public void resetData(E[] data)
        clears the data of this series and sets new. will redraw the graph
        Parameters:
        data - the values must be in the correct order! x-value has to be ASC. First the lowest x value and at least the highest x value.

      • onGraphViewAttached

        public void onGraphViewAttached(GraphView graphView)
        called when the series was added to a graph
        Specified by:
        onGraphViewAttached in interface Series<E extends DataPointInterface>
        Parameters:
        graphView - graphview

      • appendData

        public void appendData(E dataPoint,
                       boolean scrollToEnd,
                       int maxDataPoints)
        Parameters:
        dataPoint - values the values must be in the correct order! x-value has to be ASC. First the lowest x value and at least the highest x value.
        scrollToEnd - true => graphview will scroll to the end (maxX)
        maxDataPoints - if max data count is reached, the oldest data value will be lost to avoid memory leaks

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface Series<E extends DataPointInterface>
        Returns:
        whether there are data points

      • checkValueOrder

        protected void checkValueOrder(DataPointInterface onlyLast)
        checks that the data is in the correct order
        Parameters:
        onlyLast - if not null, it will only check that this datapoint is after the last point.
